definitions.definition: go or come after (a person or thing proceeding ahead); move or travel behind.
examples: she went back into the house, and Ben followed her
synonyms: walk behind More"we'll let the others follow"accompany
string along with; informaltag along with "people used to follow the band around"

definitions.definition: go after (someone) in order to observe or monitor.
examples: the KGB man followed her everywhere
synonyms: hound; informaltail "the KGB followed her everywhere"

definitions.definition: strive after; aim at.
examples: I follow fame

definitions.definition: go along (a route or path).
(of a route or path) go in the same direction as or parallel to (another).
examples: the road follows a hidden sweetwater brook

definitions.definition: come after in time or order.
examples: the six years that followed his restoration

definitions.definition: happen after (something else) as a consequence.
examples: raucous laughter followed the ribald remark
synonyms: stem from "penalties may follow from such behavior"

definitions.definition: be a logical consequence.
examples: it thus follows from this equation that the value must be negative

definitions.definition: (of a person) do something after (something else).
examples: he follows his surprise hit movie with a paranoid thriller

definitions.definition: have (a dish or course) after another or others in a meal.
examples: turkey was followed by dessert

definitions.definition: act according to (an instruction or precept).
examples: he has difficulty in following written instructions

definitions.definition: conform to.
examples: the film faithfully follows Shakespeare's plot

definitions.definition: act according to the lead or example of (someone).
examples: he follows Aristotle in believing this
synonyms: take a leaf out of someone's book "she followed her mentor in her poetic style"

definitions.definition: treat as a teacher or guide.
examples: those who seek to follow Jesus Christ

definitions.definition: pay close attention to (something).
examples: I've been following this discussion closely

definitions.definition: keep track of; trace the movement or direction of.
examples: she followed his gaze, peering into the gloom

definitions.definition: maintain awareness of the current state or progress of (events in a particular sphere or account).
examples: young Italians follow football
synonyms: be devoted to "he follows the Pacers"

definitions.definition: (of a person or account) be concerned with the development of (something).
examples: the book follows the life and career of Henry Clay

definitions.definition: track (a person, group, or organization) by subscribing to their account on a social media website or application.
examples: if you've been following me on Facebook recently you may have seen a bunch of different posts about surgery and back trouble

definitions.definition: understand the meaning or tendency of (a speaker or argument).
examples: I still don't follow you
synonyms: see; Moreinformalmake head(s) or tail(s) of
get the drift of "I couldn't follow what he said"

definitions.definition: practice (a trade or profession).
undertake or carry out (a course of action or study).
examples: she followed a strict diet
